lead_paragraph: Refugees who had already made it through the vetting procedure to be resettled in the United States reacted with disbelief to President Trump’s ban.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND, JOE COCHRANE and PATRICK KINGSLEY
byline.contributor: Rod Nordland reported from Beirut, Joe Cochrane from Jakarta, and Patrick Kingsley from New York. Reporting was contributed by Tim Arango and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul; Zahra Nader from Kabul, Afghanistan; Rana F. Sweis from Amman, Jordan; Falih Hassan and Omar Jawoshy from Baghdad; and Sima Ghaddar from Beirut, Lebanon.

headline.main: ‘Dreams Die’ for Refugees on Verge of Coming to U.S. as Trump Closes Door
headline.print_headline: ‘Dreams Die’ for Refugees on Verge of U.S. Travel as Door Closes

snippet: Refugees who had already made it through the vetting procedure to be resettled in the United States reacted with disbelief to President Trump’s ban....
